description:
A secretive Russian military unit, previously linked to assassinations and destabilization in Europe, is blamed for destructive wiper malware attacks in Ukraine.

The post Russian GRU Unit Tied to Assassinations Linked to Global Cyber Sabotage and Espionage appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Russian GRU Unit Tied to Assassinations Linked to Global Cyber Sabotage and Espionage

description:
A secretive Russian military unit, previously linked to assassinations and destabilization in Europe, is blamed for destructive wiper malware attacks in Ukraine.

The post Russian GRU Unit Tied to Assassinations Now Linked to Global Cyber Sabotage and Espionage appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Russian GRU Unit Tied to Assassinations Now Linked to Global Cyber Sabotage and Espionage

description:
Planned Parenthood confirms "cybersecurity incident" as RansomHub ransomware gang threatens to leak 93 Gb of data stolen from the nonprofit last week.

The post Ransomware Gang Claims Cyberattack on Planned Parenthood appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Ransomware Gang Claims Cyberattack on Planned Parenthood

description:
GenAI users are uploading data to over eight apps every month – what are the security and privacy concerns?

The post The AI Wild West: Unraveling the Security and Privacy Risks of GenAI Apps appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: The AI Wild West: Unraveling the Security and Privacy Risks of GenAI Apps

description:
Activity emerged from stealth with $9 million seed funding to provide solutions for enterprises to safely adopt GenAI.

The post Acuvity Raises $9 Million Seed Funding for Gen-AI Governance and In-house Development appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Acuvity Raises $9 Million Seed Funding for Gen-AI Governance and In-house Development

description:
Cisco has released patches for multiple vulnerabilities, including two critical-severity flaws in Smart Licensing Utility.

The post Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerabilities in Smart Licensing Utility appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerabilities in Smart Licensing Utility

description:
Franklin Ifeanyichukwu Okwonna and Ebuka Raphael Umeti were sentenced to prison in the US for business email compromise (BEC) fraud.

The post Two Nigerians Sentenced to Prison in US for BEC Fraud appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Two Nigerians Sentenced to Prison in US for BEC Fraud

description:
Microchip Technology says employee contact information and other types of data was stolen in an August ransomware attack.

The post Microchip Technology Confirms Personal Information Stolen in Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Microchip Technology Confirms Personal Information Stolen in Ransomware Attack

description:
An AI model trained on 10 to the 26th floating-point operations per second must now be reported to the U.S. government and could soon trigger even stricter requirements in California.

The post How Do You Know When AI is Powerful Enough to be Dangerous? Regulators Try to Do the Math appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: How Do You Know When AI is Powerful Enough to be Dangerous? Regulators Try to Do the Math

description:
Two DrayTek vulnerabilities added by CISA to its KEV catalog have been exploited by multiple threat groups to steal data from organizations worldwide.

The post DrayTek Vulnerabilities Added to CISA KEV Catalog Exploited in Global Campaign  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: DrayTek Vulnerabilities Added to CISA KEV Catalog Exploited in Global Campaign

description:
The US has cracked down on an influence operation sponsored by the Russian government, announcing charges, sanctions and domain seizures.

The post US Targets Russian Election Influence Operation With Charges, Sanctions, Domain Seizures appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Targets Russian Election Influence Operation With Charges, Sanctions, Domain Seizures
